body: Many magic items don't need to be activated. Certain magic items, however, do need to be activated, especially potions, scrolls, wands, rods, and staves. Unless otherwise noted, activating a magic item is a standard action.
name: Activate Magic Item
url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Combat/Actions In Combat/Standard Actions/Activate Magic Item

sections.body: Activating a spell completion item is the equivalent of casting a spell. It requires concentration and provokes attacks of opportunity. You lose the spell if your concentration is broken, and you can attempt to activate the item while on the defensive, as with casting a spell.
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Combat/Actions In Combat/Standard Actions/Activate Magic Item/Spell Completion Items
sections.name: Spell Completion Items

sections.body: Activating any of these kinds of items does not require concentration and does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Combat/Actions In Combat/Standard Actions/Activate Magic Item/Spell Trigger/Command Word/or Use-Activated Items
sections.name: Spell Trigger, Command Word, or Use-Activated Items
